required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Once-Daily KRP-104 in Type 2 Diabetics With Inadequate Glycemic Control on Metformin Alone
clinical_study.official_title: A 24-Week, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Asses the Safety and Efficacy of Once-Daily KRP-104 in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes With Inadequate Glycemic Control on Metformin Alone.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and effectiveness of KRP-104 on glycemic control in patients with type 2 diabetes inadequately controlled on metformin alone.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c From Baseline (Week 0) to Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Mean Change in HbA1c (%) from Baseline to Week 24 with LOCF, ITT population LS mean (SE)

secondary_outcome.description: Mean Change in Body Weight (kg) from Baseline to Week 24 with LOCF- ITT

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Achieving HbA1c Less Than 7%
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects Achieving Target of Hemoglobin A1c <7.0% at Week 24 with LOCF - Intent-to-Treat Population

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Requiring Rescue Therapy for Elevated Glucose
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Subjects Requiring Rescue Therapy - Intent-to-Treat Population

arm_group.description: Tablet, once-daily for 24 weeks (dose switch from 20 to 120 mg at week 12)

results_reference.citation: Plotkin DJ, Lewin A, Logan D, Kato T, Kozarich J, Wei X, Vest J, Orloff D. KRP-104, A Uniquely Prandial-Targeted DPP-4 Inhibitor. Abstract and Poster # 822, Presented at: European Association for the Study of Diabetes 38th Annual Meeting, Berlin Germany, October 1-5, 2012.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Conducted in 55 medical clinics in 6 countries: US, Guatemala, South Africa, Russia, Czech Republic, Poland. First site opened 19 October 2009.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Variable screening duration to allow for wash-out of one oral therapy, optimization and stabilization of dose on metformin monotherapy (>= 10 weeks);followed by 2 week placebo run-in. Fasting CBG <240 mg/dL at start of run in and prior to randomization required.

group.title: Dose 4: KRP-104
group.description: 20 mg /120 mg QD (dose switch at week12)

outcome.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline (Week 0) to Week 24
outcome.description: Mean Change in HbA1c (%) from Baseline to Week 24 with LOCF, ITT population LS mean (SE)
outcome.population: Conducted analyses of ITT population of change in HbA1c from baseline (Week 0) to Week 24. If the Wk 24 measurement was missing, the last valid post-baseline observation (LOCF) algorithm was used to impute Week 24 value (1 on-treatment value required). Efficacy data collected after the initiation of rescue therapy was excluded from the analyses.

measure.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline (Week 0) to Week 24
measure.description: Mean Change in HbA1c (%) from Baseline to Week 24 with LOCF, ITT population LS mean (SE)
measure.population: Conducted analyses of ITT population of change in HbA1c from baseline (Week 0) to Week 24. If the Wk 24 measurement was missing, the last valid post-baseline observation (LOCF) algorithm was used to impute Week 24 value (1 on-treatment value required). Efficacy data collected after the initiation of rescue therapy was excluded from the analyses.

outcome.title: Change in Body Weight
outcome.description: Mean Change in Body Weight (kg) from Baseline to Week 24 with LOCF- ITT

measure.title: Change in Body Weight
measure.description: Mean Change in Body Weight (kg) from Baseline to Week 24 with LOCF- ITT

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients Achieving HbA1c Less Than 7%
outcome.description: Subjects Achieving Target of Hemoglobin A1c <7.0% at Week 24 with LOCF – Intent-to-Treat Population

measure.title: Percentage of Patients Requiring Rescue Therapy for Elevated Glucose
measure.description: Percentage of Subjects Requiring Rescue Therapy – Intent-to-Treat Population

reported_events.time_frame: From first site open on 19 October 2009 through 30 days after last subject out on 20 January 2011, approximately 1 year 5 months.
reported_events.desc: Only treatment related adverse events were reported in the clinical study report. There were no occurrences of serious adverse events that were considered related to drug, thus none met criterion of reportable event.

event.description: not related, start date= study day 27 subject was subsequently also diagnosed with human immunodeficiency virus

event.sub_title: Fracture Of The Left Anterior Lamina Papyracea (Ethmoid Bone)

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: No explicit limitations on discussion by PI. PI may not publish results before a coordinated multicenter publication has been submitted for publication, marketing approval obtained, or until 7 years after the study has ended, whichever occurs first. Thereafter, the study site will have the opportunity to publish the results of the study, provided that the Sponsor has had the opportunity to review and comment on the study site’s proposed publication prior to it being submitted for publication.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Dr. Diane Plotkin, Sr. Director Clinical Development
